boardgame.name: Citrus
boardgame.description: Oranges or lemons or both? Create a new plantation or extend an existing one? Collect landscape tiles or rather build onto a finca in order to cultivate the most points during the next evaluation?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Citrus provides players with new challenges, and little is left to chance. The moves are simple, but the decisions are tricky. Players build citrus plantations for points, yet in order to build, it's essential to harvest your plantations from time to time as this is the only way to bring new income into your account _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;ndash; but when is the timing right? And most importantly, which plantation should you harvest, thus taking it out of the race for the important points during the finca scoring?_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Citrus is a tile-laying game for 2-5 players ages 10 and up with a playing time of about 50 minutes. The game contains a simplified family variant as well as a short version of the game. Citrus is particularly suitable for two players._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: #39: Two Player Games six-pack; Citrus on tap; Isle of Skye _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;amp; Avenue
#88: Gamers for Cures Gaming Marathon; Atlantis Rising KS preview; Burnpile Harvest Festival
Episode 21 - Maturity Is Out The Window (Featuring Ganz Schon Clever, Joraku, Citrus, Cat Lady, Transatlantic, Terraforming Mars, Barony, Pixie Queen, Altiplano, Riverboat, and more!)
Episode 28 - Game Development with Josh Lobkowicz
Episode 35: Sakura, 1960: The Making of the President, Pit Crew, 7 Wonders Duel, Citrus
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 74

Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable
